intro: Calotis dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Calotis dilatata is often found in sandy or coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
